title: Synthetic Recap
body:
INDIANAPOLIS – On a night where baskets were a precious commodity, one man authored a performance for the ages.

Glen Rice of the Charlotte Hornets didn’t just win a game; he carried his team, delivering a staggering 47-point masterpiece to will the Hornets to a heart-stopping 95-94 victory over the Indiana Pacers. In an era of grueling, physical basketball, Rice’s offensive explosion was nothing short of historic, single-handedly outscoring the entire Pacers team through three quarters.

While Indiana’s Reggie Miller fought valiantly to keep pace, finishing with a team-high 30 points, his effort was merely a supporting act to Rice’s spectacular solo. The Hornets’ offense flowed through their sharpshooting forward, with his 47 points representing nearly half of Charlotte’s total output. His dominance was the sole reason the Hornets remained within striking distance in a game where their next highest scorer, Vlade Divac, managed just 11 points.

The final seconds were a microcosm of the entire contest: a desperate defensive stand by Charlotte to preserve the one-point lead that Rice had so painstakingly built. As the final horn sounded, the story was not about a play or a scheme, but about one man’s transcendent talent.

In a league that celebrates its legends, Glen Rice carved his name into the record books on this night. This was more than a narrow road win; it was an iconic, individual tour de force that will be remembered whenever the history of the game is told.
